abstract.p: New park-and-ride service for Metro-North riders using train station in Chappaqua, NY, is set to begin (S)

block.p: A new park-and-ride service for Metro-North riders who use the Chappaqua train station will begin on Tuesday. Passengers can park at Gedney Park in Millwood or at the Willowbrook Swim Club in Mount Kisco and ride a 20-passenger shuttle bus to the station. The shuttle will meet three morning trains, beginning with the 8:46 and 11 evening trains, starting at 5:13. Those who sign up for the service, which is free for holders of New Castle parking permits, will be guaranteed two free taxi rides a month in case they miss the bus. The program mirrors one run by Metro-North that shuttles passengers across the Tappan Zee Bridge to the Tarrytown station.
